Guinea Ecuatorial - Proyecto de
            Rehabilitacion Del Cacao

abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Cocoa
            rehabilitation Project in Equatorial Guinea were to: (a)
            alleviate the constraints impeding the increased production
            of cocoa; (b) establish the necessary infrastructure to
            maintain the momentum of development in the cocoa sub-sector
            in the future; and (c) increase cocoa production in the
            project area and improve quality control of cocoa beans.
            Although two out of three objectives of the project were
            substantially met based on the re-estimated economic rate of
            return at completion, the overall performance of the project
            was unsatisfactory. This Economic Rate of Return (ERR) was
            due largely to the decline in world prices and in
            production. The mid-term evaluation noted that the
            projection of area to be rehabilitated was over-optimistic.
            Notwithstanding the overall economic performance, the
            project was overall successful in meeting the first two
            objectives of the project: (a) alleviate the constraints
            impeding the increased production of cocoa and (b) establish
            the infrastructure to maintain the momentum of development
            in the future. The project was, however, only partially
            successful in meeting the third objective, i.e. increase
            cocoa production in the project area and improve quality
            control of cocoa beans. While the project was successful in
            improving the quality control of cocoa beans, the production
            targets at appraisal were not met because of overoptimistic
            projections concerning size of holdings and number of
            participating farmers.
